intro: Phyllanthus itamarajuensis, commonly known as the Itamaraju starfruit, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to Brazil. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Its botanical features include a woody stem and alternate foliage, making it easily identifiable in its natural habitat.
